trans-unit.source: StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint - garbage collection | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint - garbage collection | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to delete BLOBs immediately when using StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to delete BLOBs immediately when using StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: In this procedure, you will:
trans-unit.target: In this procedure, you will:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Prepare to run the Maintainer executable</linkText><title></title></link> .
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Prepare to run the Maintainer executable</linkText><title></title></link> .

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Prepare the content database and Recycle Bin for immediate deletion of orphaned BLOBs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Prepare the content database and Recycle Bin for immediate deletion of orphaned BLOBs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Run Maintainer.exe</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Run Maintainer.exe</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Revert the content database and Recycle Bin settings</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Revert the content database and Recycle Bin settings</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To prepare to run the Maintainer
trans-unit.target: To prepare to run the Maintainer

trans-unit.source: On the Web front-end server, open the SharePoint 2013 Management Shell as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: On the Web front-end server, open the SharePoint 2013 Management Shell as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder <html></html>:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Remote Blob Storage 10.50\Maintainer\.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder <html></html>:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Remote Blob Storage 10.50\Maintainer\.

trans-unit.source: Rename Microsoft.Data.SqlRemoteBlobs.Maintainer.exe.config to web.config.
trans-unit.target: Rename Microsoft.Data.SqlRemoteBlobs.Maintainer.exe.config to web.config.

trans-unit.source: Use aspnet_regiis -pdf connectionStrings to decrypt the web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Use aspnet_regiis -pdf connectionStrings to decrypt the web.config file.

trans-unit.source: In the decrypted web.config file, under the **<html></html>** node, add the connection string for your SQL server instance and the content database name. See the following example.
trans-unit.target: In the decrypted web.config file, under the **<html></html>** node, add the connection string for your SQL server instance and the content database name. See the following example.

trans-unit.source: Use aspnet_regiis –pef connectionStrings to re-encrypt the web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Use aspnet_regiis –pef connectionStrings to re-encrypt the web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Rename web.config to Microsoft.Data.SqlRemoteBlobs.Maintainer.exe.config.
trans-unit.target: Rename web.config to Microsoft.Data.SqlRemoteBlobs.Maintainer.exe.config.

trans-unit.source: To prepare the content database and Recycle Bin to immediately delete orphaned BLOBs
trans-unit.target: To prepare the content database and Recycle Bin to immediately delete orphaned BLOBs

trans-unit.source: On the SQL Server, in SQL Management Studio, run the following update queries for the target content database:
trans-unit.target: On the SQL Server, in SQL Management Studio, run the following update queries for the target content database:

trans-unit.source: On the web front-end server, under Central Administration, edit the Web Application General Settings for the desired content database to temporarily disable the Recycle Bin.
trans-unit.target: On the web front-end server, under Central Administration, edit the Web Application General Settings for the desired content database to temporarily disable the Recycle Bin.

trans-unit.source: This action will also empty the Recycle Bin for any related site collections.
trans-unit.target: This action will also empty the Recycle Bin for any related site collections.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click Central Administration -> Application Management -> Web Applications (Manage web applications) -> SharePoint - 80 -> General Application Settings.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click Central Administration -> Application Management -> Web Applications (Manage web applications) -> SharePoint - 80 -> General Application Settings.

trans-unit.source: Set the Recycle Bin Status to OFF.
trans-unit.target: Set the Recycle Bin Status to OFF.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Web Application General Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Web Application General Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To run the Maintainer
trans-unit.target: To run the Maintainer

trans-unit.source: On the web front-end server, in the SharePoint 2013 Management Shell, run the Maintainer as follows:
trans-unit.target: On the web front-end server, in the SharePoint 2013 Management Shell, run the Maintainer as follows:

trans-unit.source: Only the GarbageCollection operation is supported for StorSimple at this time.
trans-unit.target: Only the GarbageCollection operation is supported for StorSimple at this time.

trans-unit.source: Also note that the parameters issued for Microsoft.Data.SqlRemoteBlobs.Maintainer.exe are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Also note that the parameters issued for Microsoft.Data.SqlRemoteBlobs.Maintainer.exe are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: To revert the content database and Recycle Bin settings
trans-unit.target: To revert the content database and Recycle Bin settings

trans-unit.source: On the SQL Server, in SQL Management Studio, run the following update queries for the target content database:
trans-unit.target: On the SQL Server, in SQL Management Studio, run the following update queries for the target content database:

trans-unit.source: use WSS_Content
trans-unit.target: use WSS_Content

trans-unit.source: exec mssqlrbs.rbs_sp_set_config_value ‘garbage_collection_time_window’ , ‘days 30’
trans-unit.target: exec mssqlrbs.rbs_sp_set_config_value ‘garbage_collection_time_window’ , ‘days 30’

trans-unit.source: exec mssqlrbs.rbs_sp_set_config_value ‘delete_scan_period’ , ’days 30’
trans-unit.target: exec mssqlrbs.rbs_sp_set_config_value ‘delete_scan_period’ , ’days 30’

trans-unit.source: exec mssqlrbs.rbs_sp_set_config_value ‘orphan_scan_period’ , ’days 30’
trans-unit.target: exec mssqlrbs.rbs_sp_set_config_value ‘orphan_scan_period’ , ’days 30’

trans-unit.source: On the web front-end server, in Central Administration, edit the Web Application General Settings for the desired content database to re-enable the Recycle Bin.
trans-unit.target: On the web front-end server, in Central Administration, edit the Web Application General Settings for the desired content database to re-enable the Recycle Bin.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click Central Administration -> Application Management -> Web Applications (Manage web applications) -> SharePoint - 80 -> General Application Settings.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click Central Administration -> Application Management -> Web Applications (Manage web applications) -> SharePoint - 80 -> General Application Settings.

trans-unit.source: Set the Recycle Bin Status to ON.
trans-unit.target: Set the Recycle Bin Status to ON.
